Part time and temporary work

Many students work part time at university and in the holidays in a range of roles, commonly in hospitality, service and leisure sectors

  • Involves CV preparation and interview
  • Usually paid at least national minimum wage*
  • Helps develop valuable employability skills such as communication, team building and time management skills.

* UK/EU undergraduate students are advised not to work in excess of 20 hours per week, International students on a Tier 4 visa are not legally allowed to work more than 20 hours per week in term time. All undergraduates may work full-time in vacation periods.

** International student visa holders are not usually eligible to undertake a 12-month internship as a Voluntary Year Out for Work Experience within their degree, as this extends their studies beyond the agreed time limit on their visa.

For more information on the regulations on working as an international student, check the UKCISA website
